performed_via_github_app.name: Vercel
performed_via_github_app.description:
Vercel for GitHub automatically deploys your PRs to Vercel.
Preview every PR live, without any configuration required.

For more information, see our [documentation](https://vercel.com/docs/github?utm_source=github&utm_medium=marketplace&utm_campaign=vercel-app).

![](https://assets.vercel.com/image/upload/v1597943727/front/github/github-comment-monorepo.png)

body:
## Reviewer's Guide Adds a Gemini-based vision extraction pipeline and multiple visual validation utilities for BMW X5 Egyptian brochure tables, including crop detection, HTML table replication, and side‚Äëby‚Äëside comparison artifacts, plus pins a large set of vision/OCR/table-extraction dependencies. #### Sequence diagram for end-to-end BMW X5 specs extraction and visual validation ```mermaid sequenceDiagram actor Developer participant CLI as CommandLine participant GVE as GeminiVisionExtractor participant GeminiAPI participant FS as FileSystem participant VV as visual_validator_module participant BR as bmw_x5_table_replicas_module participant ACV as auto_crop_validator_module Developer->>CLI: Run gemini_vision_extractor.py CLI->>GVE: extract_specs(png_path, brand, model_name, expected_trims) GVE->>GVE: _build_extraction_prompt(...) GVE->>GeminiAPI: generate_content(prompt, pdf_image_png) GeminiAPI-->>GVE: JSON text response GVE->>GVE: _parse_response(response_text) GVE-->>CLI: extraction_result Dict CLI->>FS: Write results/bmw_x5_gemini_flash.json Developer->>CLI: Run visual_validator.py CLI->>VV: create_side_by_side_comparison(original_pdf_png, extraction_json, output_png) VV->>FS: load_extraction_result(json_path) VV->>VV: create_table_image(data) VV->>FS: Save combined original_vs_extraction PNG Developer->>CLI: Run bmw_x5_table_replicas.py CLI->>FS: Read pdf_images page PNG and extraction JSON CLI->>BR: crop_table_from_pdf(... table1..3 ...) BR->>BR: map_specs_to_table1/2/3(specs) BR->>BR: generate_html_table(table_specs, trims, table_name) BR->>BR: html_to_png(html_content) using wkhtmltoimage or weasyprint BR->>BR: create_side_by_side(original_crop, replica_png) BR->>FS: Save orig_vs_replica PNGs Developer->>CLI: Run auto_crop_validator.py CLI->>FS: Load full_page and manual table crops CLI->>ACV: validate_crops(full_page, manual_crops, output_dir) ACV->>ACV: detect_table_regions(full_page) ACV->>ACV: calculate_iou(auto_bbox, manual_bbox) ACV->>FS: Save auto crops, overlays, task1_validation_report.json ``` #### Class diagram for Gemini vision extraction and validation utilities ```mermaid classDiagram class GeminiVisionExtractor { -string model_name -string api_key -GenerativeModel model +__init__(model_name, api_key) +extract_specs(png_path, brand, model_name, expected_trims) Dict +_build_extraction_prompt(brand, model_name, expected_trims) str +_parse_response(response_text) Dict } class gemini_vision_extractor_module { +extract_specs_vision(png_path, brand, model_name, gemini_model, expected_trims) Dict } class visual_validator_module { +load_extraction_result(json_path) Dict +create_table_image(data, width, font_size) Image +create_side_by_side_comparison(original_pdf_path, extraction_json_path, output_path) Dict } class bmw_x5_table_replicas_module { +load_extraction_json(json_path) Dict +crop_table_from_pdf(pdf_image_path, table_name, output_dir) str +map_specs_to_table1(specs) List~Dict~ +map_specs_to_table2(specs) List~Dict~ +map_specs_to_table3(specs) List~Dict~ +generate_html_table(specs, trims, table_name) str +html_to_png(html_content, output_path, width) bool +create_side_by_side(original_crop, replica_png, output_path) None } class auto_crop_validator_module { +calculate_iou(box1, box2) float +get_manual_crop_bbox(manual_crop_img, full_page_img) Tuple~int,int,int,int~ +detect_table_regions(full_page_img, seed_coords) Dict~string,Tuple~int,int,int,int~~ +create_validation_overlay(full_page_img, auto_bbox, manual_bbox, table_name) Image +validate_crops(full_page_path, manual_crop_paths, output_dir) Dict } GeminiVisionExtractor <.. gemini_vision_extractor_module : used by visual_validator_module <.. bmw_x5_table_replicas_module : reads specs JSON auto_crop_validator_module <.. bmw_x5_table_replicas_module : validates crops visual_validator_module <.. auto_crop_validator_module : shares validation outputs ``` ### File-Level Changes | Change | Details | Files | | ------ | ------- | ----- | | Add script to generate HTML replicas of three BMW X5 tables and produce side‚Äëby‚Äëside comparison images against the PDF. |
  • Hard‚Äëcode pixel crops for three BMW X5 page‚Äë15 tables and implement a crop helper using Pillow.
  • Implement mapping functions that partition extracted specs into three logical tables based on category names.
  • Generate BMW‚Äëstyled HTML tables from structured specs, then rasterize them to PNG using wkhtmltoimage with a WeasyPrint fallback.
  • Compose original and replica table images into labeled side‚Äëby‚Äëside PNGs for visual inspection.
  • Provide a CLI entrypoint that reads Gemini extraction JSON, runs all three pipelines, and writes validation PNGs under validation/.
| `extraction_engine/bmw_x5_table_replicas.py` | | Introduce an automated crop validator that compares heuristic table crops on the 600‚ÄëDPI full page against manual ground‚Äëtruth crops and reports IoU metrics. |
  • Define Egyptian‚Äëlayout heuristics and seed bounding boxes scaled from 300‚ÄëDPI coordinates.
  • Implement IoU calculation for (x, y, w, h) boxes and placeholder logic to infer manual crop bounding boxes from pre‚Äëcropped images.
  • Detect table regions from the full‚Äëpage image using seed coordinates (with hooks for future refinement), then extract and save auto crops.
  • Render overlays showing manual vs auto boxes in different colors, cropped around each table, and save them for review.
  • Emit a JSON validation report with IoU, bounding boxes, and dimensional errors per table via a CLI main().
| `extraction_engine/auto_crop_validator.py` | | Add a Gemini Vision extractor wrapper to call Google‚Äôs Gemini 2.5 models on PNG spec tables and output normalized spec JSON. |
  • Configure google-generativeai with GEMINI_API_KEY, construct a GenerativeModel, and expose an extract_specs method for PNG inputs.
  • Build a detailed prompt that explains the desired trims/specs schema, hierarchy, visual cues, and JSON‚Äëonly output constraints.
  • Call generate_content with JSON response MIME type and parse the response into a structured Python dict, adding timing and model metadata.
  • Handle JSON parsing fallbacks for markdown‚Äëwrapped responses and surface errors in a consistent error/metadata shape.
  • Provide a convenience function and CLI so the extractor can be invoked from the shell with PNG path, brand, model, and model name.
| `extraction_engine/gemini_vision_extractor.py` | | Create a visual validator that renders extraction JSON into a simple table image and juxtaposes it with the original PDF page. |
  • Load extraction JSON and construct a tabular rasterization of specs/trims using Pillow, including headers and basic category striping.
  • Normalize image heights between the original PDF PNG and the rendered table so they can be placed side by side on a shared canvas.
  • Annotate the combined image with titles indicating original vs Gemini extraction and save the comparison PNG.
  • Compute basic metrics like spec and trim counts, echo the model name, and flag that manual review is required against a 95% threshold.
  • Expose a CLI entrypoint wiring JSON path, original PNG path, and optional output path, creating parent directories as needed.
| `extraction_engine/visual_validator.py` | | Pin a comprehensive dependency set for PDF/image/table extraction and LLM integrations, and add benchmark placeholders and model outputs. |
  • Introduce extraction_engine/requirements.txt with pinned versions for OCR (paddleocr, pytesseract), PDF tooling (pdfplumber, camelot-py, tabula-py, pdf2image), ML/vision (torch, torchvision, layoutparser, timm, img2table), LLM SDKs (anthropic, google-generativeai, google-genai, aistudio-sdk), and supporting libraries.
  • Add empty or precomputed result artifacts under extraction_engine/results/, including per‚Äëmodel BMW X5 extraction JSONs and a benchmark_quality_report placeholder.
| `extraction_engine/requirements.txt`
`extraction_engine/results/benchmark_quality_report.txt`
`extraction_engine/results/bmw_x5_claude_haiku45.json`
`extraction_engine/results/bmw_x5_claude_sonnet45.json`
`extraction_engine/results/bmw_x5_gemini_flash.json`
`extraction_engine/results/bmw_x5_gemini_pro.json` | ---
Tips and commands #### Interacting with Sourcery - **Trigger a new review:** Comment `@sourcery-ai review` on the pull request. - **Continue discussions:** Reply directly to Sourcery's review comments. - **Generate a GitHub issue from a review comment:** Ask Sourcery to create an issue from a review comment by replying to it. You can also reply to a review comment with `@sourcery-ai issue` to create an issue from it. - **Generate a pull request title:** Write `@sourcery-ai` anywhere in the pull request title to generate a title at any time. You can also comment `@sourcery-ai title` on the pull request to (re-)generate the title at any time. - **Generate a pull request summary:** Write `@sourcery-ai summary` anywhere in the pull request body to generate a PR summary at any time exactly where you want it. You can also comment `@sourcery-ai summary` on the pull request to (re-)generate the summary at any time. - **Generate reviewer's guide:** Comment `@sourcery-ai guide` on the pull request to (re-)generate the reviewer's guide at any time. - **Resolve all Sourcery comments:** Comment `@sourcery-ai resolve` on the pull request to resolve all Sourcery comments. Useful if you've already addressed all the comments and don't want to see them anymore. - **Dismiss all Sourcery reviews:** Comment `@sourcery-ai dismiss` on the pull request to dismiss all existing Sourcery reviews. Especially useful if you want to start fresh with a new review - don't forget to comment `@sourcery-ai review` to trigger a new review! #### Customizing Your Experience Access your [dashboard](https://app.sourcery.ai) to: - Enable or disable review features such as the Sourcery-generated pull request summary, the reviewer's guide, and others. - Change the review language. - Add, remove or edit custom review instructions. - Adjust other review settings. #### Getting Help - [Contact our support team](mailto:support@sourcery.ai) for questions or feedback. - Visit our [documentation](https://docs.sourcery.ai) for detailed guides and information. - Keep in touch with the Sourcery team by following us on [X/Twitter](https://x.com/SourceryAI), [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/sourcery-ai/) or [GitHub](https://github.com/sourcery-ai).

## Instant AI code reviews

- Speed up your code review process
- Improve your code quality and ensure high quality code
- Spend less time on reviews
- Accelerate development velocity

body:
> [!IMPORTANT] > ## Review skipped > > Draft detected. > > Please check the settings in the CodeRabbit UI or the `.coderabbit.yaml` file in this repository. To trigger a single review, invoke the `@coderabbitai review` command. > > You can disable this status message by setting the `reviews.review_status` to `false` in the CodeRabbit configuration file. > [!WARNING] > ### `.coderabbit.yaml` has a parsing error > > The CodeRabbit configuration file in this repository has a parsing error and default settings were used instead. Please fix the error(s) in the configuration file. You can initialize chat with CodeRabbit to get help with the configuration file. > >
> üí• Parsing errors (1) > > ``` > Validation error: Expected array, received object at "reviews.path_filters" > ``` > >
> >
> ‚öôÔ∏è Configuration instructions > > - Please see the [configuration documentation](https://docs.coderabbit.ai/guides/configure-coderabbit) for more information. > - You can also validate your configuration using the [online YAML validator](https://docs.coderabbit.ai/configuration/yaml-validator). > - If your editor has YAML language server enabled, you can add the path at the top of this file to enable auto-completion and validation: `# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://coderabbit.ai/integrations/schema.v2.json` > >
## Walkthrough Adds multiple new extraction and validation tools: a Gemini-based vision extractor, automated crop validator with IoU and overlays, BMW X5 HTML-to-image table replica generator, visual side-by-side validator, large requirements file, benchmark report, and several model extraction JSON results. ## Changes | Cohort / File(s) | Summary | |---|---| | **Vision extraction**
`extraction_engine/gemini_vision_extractor.py` | New `GeminiVisionExtractor` class and helpers: builds detailed extraction prompt, calls Gemini Vision API with image, parses JSON-like responses, returns structured specs with metadata and error handling; includes CLI helper `extract_specs_vision`. | | **Automated crop validation**
`extraction_engine/auto_crop_validator.py` | New end-to-end validation module: IoU calculation, seed-based table-region detection scaffold, manual-bbox placeholder resolver, overlay image generation, per-table crop saving, JSON validation report, and CLI `main`. | | **Visual validation (side-by-side)**
`extraction_engine/visual_validator.py` | New tooling to render extraction JSON as a table image, compose side-by-side comparison with original PDF crop, save outputs, and emit metrics/threshold for manual review; includes CLI entry. | | **BMW X5 table replica generator**
`extraction_engine/bmw_x5_table_replicas.py` | New utility to crop three hard-coded BMW X5 table regions, map specs into three table variants, generate styled HTML, render to PNG (wkhtmltoimage with WeasyPrint fallback), and create side-by-side original vs replica images. | | **Image/extraction helpers & small edits**
`extraction_engine/claude_vision_extractor.py` | Adds upfront PNG path existence validation to `extract_specs`, returning structured error payload when file missing (no public API signature change). | | **Dependencies**
`extraction_engine/requirements.txt` | New comprehensive requirements file listing many ML/vision/OCR/PDF/Google client and CUDA-related packages and pinned versions. | | **Benchmark & result artifacts**
`extraction_engine/results/benchmark_quality_report.txt`, `extraction_engine/results/bmw_x5_gemini_*.json`, `extraction_engine/results/bmw_x5_claude_*.json` | New benchmark quality report and multiple JSON extraction result files (Gemini flash/pro, Claude Sonnet/Haiku) with per-trim/spec matrices and metadata. | ## Sequence Diagram(s) ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User participant FS as FileSystem participant GeminiAPI as GeminiVisionAPI participant VisionExt as GeminiVisionExtractor participant VisualVal as VisualValidator participant AutoCrop as AutoCropValidator Note over User,VisionExt: Vision-based spec extraction User->>FS: provide image path VisionExt->>FS: open image VisionExt->>GeminiAPI: send image + prompt GeminiAPI-->>VisionExt: JSON-like response VisionExt->>VisionExt: _parse_response() VisionExt-->>User: specs Dict + metadata Note over User,VisualVal: Visual side-by-side validation User->>VisualVal: request comparison (pdf image + extraction JSON) VisualVal->>FS: load extraction JSON VisualVal->>FS: load original image VisualVal->>VisualVal: render table image VisualVal->>VisualVal: compose side-by-side image VisualVal-->>User: output image + metrics Note over User,AutoCrop: Automated crop validation User->>AutoCrop: validate_crops(full_page, manual_crops) AutoCrop->>FS: load full page + manual crop images AutoCrop->>AutoCrop: detect_table_regions(seed_coords) AutoCrop->>AutoCrop: compute auto crop bboxes AutoCrop->>AutoCrop: calculate_iou(auto_bbox, manual_bbox) AutoCrop->>FS: save overlays, crop images, JSON report AutoCrop-->>User: validation report + artifacts ``` ## Estimated code review effort üéØ 4 (Complex) | ‚è±Ô∏è ~50 minutes - Pay special attention to: - Gemini API usage: prompt content, API key handling, request/response error cases, and robust JSON extraction/parsing in `gemini_vision_extractor.py`. - Image coordinate math and DPI/scale handling across `auto_crop_validator.py`, `bmw_x5_table_replicas.py`, and `visual_validator.py` (bbox translations, crop extents, resizing). - HTML-to-image rendering paths and fallbacks in `bmw_x5_table_replicas.py` (wkhtmltoimage vs WeasyPrint) and error propagation. - Large requirements file (`requirements.txt`) for correctness of pinned versions and any platform-specific packages. - Validation of JSON result file formats for consistency with rendering/mapping functions. ## Pre-merge checks and finishing touches
‚ùå Failed checks (1 inconclusive) | Check name | Status | Explanation | Resolution | | :---------: | :------------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Title check | ‚ùì Inconclusive | The title 'WIP: PDF table extraction engine for Egyptian brochures' is partially related to the changeset, referring to a real component (PDF table extraction), but it is vague, uses a non-descriptive prefix (WIP), and does not convey the actual scope‚Äîwhich includes Gemini/Claude vision APIs, HTML rendering, validation scripts, and comprehensive dependencies. | Replace vague 'WIP: PDF table extraction engine' with a more descriptive title highlighting key additions: e.g., 'Add vehicle spec extraction pipeline with Gemini/Claude Vision and validation tooling' or similar that better reflects the full scope. |
‚úÖ Passed checks (2 passed) | Check name | Status | Explanation | | :----------------: | :------- | :---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Description Check | ‚úÖ Passed | Check skipped - CodeRabbit‚Äôs high-level summary is enabled. | | Docstring Coverage | ‚úÖ Passed | Docstring coverage is 96.00% which is sufficient. The required threshold is 80.00%. |
--- Thanks for using [CodeRabbit](https://coderabbit.ai?utm_source=oss&utm_medium=github&utm_campaign=Hex-Tech-Lab/hex-test-drive-man&utm_content=7)! It's free for OSS, and your support helps us grow. If you like it, consider giving us a shout-out.
‚ù§Ô∏è Share - [X](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=I%20just%20used%20%40coderabbitai%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20the%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A&url=https%3A//coderabbit.ai) - [Mastodon](https://mastodon.social/share?text=I%20just%20used%20%40coderabbitai%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20the%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A%20https%3A%2F%2Fcoderabbit.ai) - [Reddit](https://www.reddit.com/submit?title=Great%20tool%20for%20code%20review%20-%20CodeRabbit&text=I%20just%20used%20CodeRabbit%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A%20https%3A//coderabbit.ai) - [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/sharing/share-offsite/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcoderabbit.ai&mini=true&title=Great%20tool%20for%20code%20review%20-%20CodeRabbit&summary=I%20just%20used%20CodeRabbit%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20proprietary%20code)

performed_via_github_app.name: coderabbitai
performed_via_github_app.description:
# Transforming Code Reviews with AI

## Features

**Automated Reviews**: Continuous reviews of the pull requests including incremental commits. 

**Summarization**: Generates high-level summary and a technical walkthrough of the PR changes.¬†

**Line-by-line review**: Provides line-by-line suggestions committable with one click.

**Codebase verification**:  Verifies the impact on the overall codebase and identifies missing changes.

**Insights into your code**:  Ask any questions on your codebase within the pull request 

**Chat about your code** : Chat with the bot around your code.¬†The more you chat, the smarter it gets.

**Issue Validation**:  Validates the PR against the linked issues and identifies other related issues¬†

body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated reply by CodeRabbit -->
<details>
<summary>‚úÖ Actions performed</summary>

Review triggered.

> Note: CodeRabbit is an incremental review system and does not re-review already reviewed commits. This command is applicable only when automatic reviews are paused.

</details>

# Transforming Code Reviews with AI

## Features

**Automated Reviews**: Continuous reviews of the pull requests including incremental commits. 

**Summarization**: Generates high-level summary and a technical walkthrough of the PR changes.¬†
